BootstrapÂ is a framework for responsive web design. The heart of bootstrap is a grid system. A bootstrap page consists of a series of rows that contain columns. Each row is by default divided into 12 equally wide parts and a column can span over 1 to 12 of these parts. Each colum itself can include a row again.

The responsive part is: Bootstrap distinguishes four devices by screen width. And the width of columns can be given for each of these devices.

Device type Extra small devices (phones) Small devices (tablets) Medium devices (Desktops) Large devices (Desktops)
Screen size <768px 768px-991px 992px-1199px >= 1200px
  • For more information on bootstrap, see www.getbootstrap.com
